intro: Silene scabridula, commonly known as the rough silene, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many showy flowering plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. It produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs, giving the plant its characteristic rough texture.
